title: Mobile-Based Mathematics Education Design to Address Digital Divide in Prisons

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematical operations and secondary-level mathematical concepts
context.additional_context: A course aiming to strengthen mathematical competencies for aspiring professionals in limited technology environments (smartphone-only). Applying mobile learning solutions to address declining educational quality and digital divide issues caused by weakened prison education infrastructure post-COVID-19

learning_goals: Learners can apply middle school mathematics fundamentals (equations, functions, geometry) with over 80% accuracy within a week via a smartphone-based microlearning platform
Learners can enhance problem-solving skills by collaborating with peer learners on projects using mobile learning tools
Learners can develop and execute self-directed learning strategies utilizing digital resources even in limited-technology environments

resources: PDF worksheets and video lecture materials
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
